Sentencas: Ni-doped perovskite anodes have been investigated for oxidation of hydrogen in IT-SOFC.
Titulo: Investigation composite Ni-doped perovskite anode catalyst for electrooxidation of hydrogen in solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Perovskite materials are characterized by mixed electronic-ionic conductivity that combined to the high intrinsic catalytic activity of Ni allows to achieve high reaction rates.
Titulo: Investigation composite Ni-doped perovskite anode catalyst for electrooxidation of hydrogen in solid oxide fuel cell

Sentencas: Suitable power densities of about 420 mW/cm(2) for the direct oxidation of hydrogen were achieved at 800 degrees C. Temperature programmed reduction analysis carried out in hydrogen reveals that the catalyst at 800 degrees C has totally lost the perovskite structure showing formation of substructures such as NiOOH and NiLa2O4.
Titulo: Investigation composite Ni-doped perovskite anode catalyst for electrooxidation of hydrogen in solid oxide fuel cell
